00082 #define PIVOT
00083 
00084 #ifdef PIVOT
00085 #    ifndef myRandom
00086         //=============================================================
00107 #        define myRandom( num ) ( rand() % ( num ) )
00108 #    endif /* random */
00109         //=============================================================
00135 #    define pivot( L, R ) ( L + myRandom( R - L ) )
00136 #else
00137         //=============================================================
00166 #    define pivot( L, R ) ( ( L >> 1 ) + ( R >> 1 ) + ( L & R & 1 ) )
00167 #endif /* PIVOT */

00169 //=============================================================
00207 template < class T >
00208 void sort( Array< T        >& value,
00209            Array< unsigned >& index )
00210 {
00211     const unsigned StackSize = 100;
00212     unsigned Lstack[ StackSize ];
00213     unsigned Rstack[ StackSize ];
00214     unsigned L, R, i, j, p, q;
00215     int      stackptr = 1;
00216     T        val;
00217     unsigned ind;
00218 
00219     // Initialize index borders:
00220     L = 0;
00221     R = value.nelem( ) - 1;
00222 
00223     // Initialize index border stacks:
00224     Lstack[ 1 ] = L;
00225     Rstack[ 1 ] = R;
00226 
00227     // Initialize index vector with the indices of the input vector values:
00228     index.resize( value.nelem( ) );
00229     for( i = L; i <= R; i++ )
00230         index.elem( i ) = i;
00231 
00232     // Sorting takes place as long as there are elements
00233     // on the index border stacks (= simulated recursion calls
00234     // left for processing):
00235     do {
00236         // Pop the top index border stacks elements, take them as new
00237         // index borders: 
00238         L = Lstack[ stackptr ];
00239         R = Rstack[ stackptr ];
00240         stackptr--;
00241 
00242         // Processing the elements between the current index borders
00243         // (= borders of the current recursion) as long as they don't meet:
00244         do {
00245             p = q = pivot( L, R ); // the current pivot values,
00246                                    // p used as backup, q can be changed
00247             i = L;                 // the left pointer
00248             j = R;                 // the right pointer
00249 
00250             // Process as long as the current left and right pointer 
00251             // don't meet:
00252             do {
00253                 // Skip left pointer elements that are already less than the
00254                 // value at the current pivot position:
00255                 while( value.elem( i ) < value.elem( q ) ) i++;
00256                 // Skip right pointer elements that are already greater than 
00257                 // the value at the current pivot position:
00258                 while( value.elem( q ) < value.elem( j ) ) j--;
00259 
00260                 if( i <= j ) {
00261                     if( i != j ) {
00262                         // One of the pointers meet the pivot?
00263                         // Set the pivot to the opposite pointer
00264                         if( p == i ) q = j;
00265                         if( p == j ) q = i;
00266 
00267                         // Swap the current left pointer and right
00268                         // pointer element
00269                         val             = value.elem( i );
00270                         value.elem( i ) = value.elem( j );
00271                         value.elem( j ) = val;
00272 
00273                         // Swap the indices of the current left pointer and 
00274                         // right pointer element
00275                         ind             = index.elem( i );
00276                         index.elem( i ) = index.elem( j );
00277                         index.elem( j ) = ind;
00278                     }
00279 
00280                     // left and right pointer are moving towards each other:
00281                     if( i < UINT_MAX ) i++;
00282                     if( j > 0        ) j--;
00283                 }
00284             } while( i <= j );
00285 
00286             // Simulate sorting recursion, by determining
00287             // the new index borders and pushing them on
00288             // the stacks (partitioning).
00289             if( ( j - L ) < ( R - i ) ) {
00290                 if( i < R ) {
00291                     stackptr++;
00292                     Lstack[ stackptr ] = i;
00293                     Rstack[ stackptr ] = R;
00294                 }
00295                 R = j;
00296             } else {
00297                 if( L < j ) {
00298                     stackptr++;
00299                     Lstack[ stackptr ] = L;
00300                     Rstack[ stackptr ] = j;
00301                 }
00302                 L = i;
00303             }
00304         } while( L < R );
00305 
00306     } while( stackptr > 0 );
00307 }

00341 void sort2DBy1st( Array< double >& value )
00342 {
00343     const unsigned StackSize = 100;
00344     unsigned Lstack[ StackSize ];
00345     unsigned Rstack[ StackSize ];
00346     unsigned L, R, i, j, p, q;
00347     int      stackptr = 1;
00348     double  val1, val2;
00349     unsigned ind;
00350 
00351     Array< unsigned > index;
00352     // Initialize index borders:
00353     L = 0;
00354     R = value.dim(0) - 1;
00355 
00356     // Initialize index border stacks:
00357     Lstack[ 1 ] = L;
00358     Rstack[ 1 ] = R;
00359 
00360     // Initialize index vector with the indices of the input vector values:
00361     index.resize( value.dim(0) );
00362     for( i = L; i <= R; i++ )
00363         index.elem( i ) = i;
00364 
00365     // Sorting takes place as long as there are elements
00366     // on the index border stacks (= simulated recursion calls
00367     // left for processing):
00368     do {
00369         // Pop the top index border stacks elements, take them as new
00370         // index borders: 
00371         L = Lstack[ stackptr ];
00372         R = Rstack[ stackptr ];
00373         stackptr--;
00374 
00375         // Processing the elements between the current index borders
00376         // (= borders of the current recursion) as long as they don't meet:
00377         do {
00378             p = q = pivot( L, R ); // the current pivot values,
00379                                    // p used as backup, q can be changed
00380             i = L;                 // the left pointer
00381             j = R;                 // the right pointer
00382 
00383             // Process as long as the current left and right pointer 
00384             // don't meet:
00385             do {
00386                 // Skip left pointer elements that are already less than the
00387                 // value at the current pivot position:
00388                 while( value(i, 0) < value(q, 0) ) i++;
00389                 // Skip right pointer elements that are already greater than 
00390                 // the value at the current pivot position:
00391                 while( value(q, 0) < value(j, 0) ) j--;
00392 
00393                 if( i <= j ) {
00394                     if( i != j ) {
00395                         // One of the pointers meet the pivot?
00396                         // Set the pivot to the opposite pointer
00397                         if( p == i ) q = j;
00398                         if( p == j ) q = i;
00399 
00400                         // Swap the current left pointer and right
00401                         // pointer element
00402                         val1            = value( i, 0 );
00403                         val2            = value( i, 1 );
00404                         value( i, 0 ) = value( j, 0 );
00405                         value( i, 1 ) = value( j, 1 );
00406                         value( j, 0 ) = val1;
00407                         value( j, 1 ) = val2;
00408 
00409                         // Swap the indices of the current left pointer and 
00410                         // right pointer element
00411                         ind             = index.elem( i );
00412                         index.elem( i ) = index.elem( j );
00413                         index.elem( j ) = ind;
00414                     }
00415 
00416                     // left and right pointer are moving towards each other:
00417                     if( i < UINT_MAX ) i++;
00418                     if( j > 0        ) j--;
00419                 }
00420             } while( i <= j );
00421 
00422             // Simulate sorting recursion, by determining
00423             // the new index borders and pushing them on
00424             // the stacks (partitioning).
00425             if( ( j - L ) < ( R - i ) ) {
00426                 if( i < R ) {
00427                     stackptr++;
00428                     Lstack[ stackptr ] = i;
00429                     Rstack[ stackptr ] = R;
00430                 }
00431                 R = j;
00432             } else {
00433                 if( L < j ) {
00434                     stackptr++;
00435                     Lstack[ stackptr ] = L;
00436                     Rstack[ stackptr ] = j;
00437                 }
00438                 L = i;
00439             }
00440         } while( L < R );
00441 
00442     } while( stackptr > 0 );
